titles.title: Death Gratuity Military bill
Honoring Our Fallen Soldiers and Families Act of 2005
Honoring Our Fallen Soldiers and Families Act of 2005
To amend title 10, United States Code, to increase the amount of the military death gratuity to $100,000.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

bill.summary: Honoring Our Fallen Soldiers and Families Act of 2005 - Increases from $12,000 to $100,000 the death gratuity payable to the survivors of members of the Armed Forces who die: (1) while on active duty or inactive duty training; or (2) within 120 days after discharge or release from such duty or training, if the death resulted from an injury or disease incurred or aggravated during such duty or training.
